qas.question: What causes the government to exert greater control over broadcast media than print media?
What was the Swiss Broadcasting Corporations name recently changed to?

context: The government exerts greater control over broadcast media than print media, especially due to <a0_0>finance and licensing<a0_0/>. The Swiss Broadcasting Corporation, whose name was recently changed to <a2_0>SRG SSR<a2_0/>, is charged with the production and broadcast of radio and television programs. SRG SSR studios are distributed throughout the various language regions. Radio content is produced in six central and four regional studios while the television programs are produced in <a1_0>Geneva, Zürich and Lugano<a1_0/>. An extensive cable network also allows most Swiss to access the programs from neighboring countries.
